question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/on_demand.move] [Function: guardian_queue()] [Validation Layer] If guardian_queue provides secondary price validation - could its compromise create single point of failure when combined with oracle_queue attack? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/on_demand.move] [Function: on_demand_package_id()] [Version Tracking] Package ID exposed but no version checking - could outdated consumers use incompatible oracle interface after package upgrade? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/on_demand.move] [Function: set_on_demand_package_id()] [Upgrade Path] Package ID mutable but no migration logic - could premature update break compatibility with existing oracle aggregator objects? (Medium)
